sentences: Kaval ja tark. Rebane... Aimab, et varsti kuri karjas... Et on tulusam kesta vahetada...
Ta kestab end tihti teise inimese ees.
Lapsevanemad kestavad oma lapsi sageli vanema lapse vastu.
context: In Estonian, 'kesta' means to pose as, masquerade as, or feign someone else's identity. The word comes from the context of changing one's appearance or behavior to appear different than one actually is, often in a deceptive manner. It can refer to putting on an act, pretending to be someone else, or concealing one's true self behind another persona.
